body.p:
Louisville Ky. Decr 26 1865
Hon Thos. E. Bramlette
Govr of Ky
Sir.

Your petitioner would respectfully represent that on the -- day of July he became surety for the appearance of John Rüger who for his app at the next term of the Louisville City Court. He says said Rüger made default, and judgment was had against him at the December Term of said ^indt^ for ($1000.x/100) One hundred dollars
He says he is a poor man and has a large family to support who are entirely dependent on him and his labor for support. And that he cannot pay the said judgment and costs without deprivation to them.
He says he has used every diligence in his power to get the sd Rüger and bring him to Justice, which is known to some of the signers of this petition
We the undersigned, citizens of Louisville would respectfullfy and earnestly request that the prayer of the petitioner be granted.

Wm. Haas
